titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the R. Freeman Butts papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff and David Jacobs

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-03-24T08:54-0700

change.item: Revised to update collection location to SAL3 and access note (Sarah Patton).
Revised to add incremental materials list, boxes 239-399 (David Jacobs).
Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::R. Freeman Butts Papers)//EN" "reg_187.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 399 manuscript boxes, 1 envelope, 16 slide boxes, 1 sound cassette

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, reports, studies, conference papers and proceedings, syllabi, curricular material, clippings, and other printed matter relating to the role of education in society, civic education, education in the United States, and international education.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection open for research. Boxes are stored off site; a minimum of two days notice is required for use. Boxes may be requested through Stanford's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], R. Freeman Butts papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1980, with a substantial increment added later.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Awarded bachelor of arts degree, University of Wisconsin
Author, The Education of the West
Author, Public Education in the United States: From Revolution to Reform
Author, The Civic Mission in Educational Reform: Perspectives for the Public and the Profession
Author, In the First Person Singular: The Foundations of Education

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The R. Freeman Butts collection contains writings, research materials, correspondence, and other materials relating to a prominent American educator. A prolific author, Butts wrote a number of books and contributed numerous articles to professional journals in the field of education. Butts wrote extensively on themes of public education and citizenship; he wrote critically about efforts to privatize education and create charter schools. He also participated in numerous professional organizations, and the collection contains correspondence, minutes of meetings, and reports relating to these activities. Additionally, the collection contains biographical materials, including student papers and photographs.
